register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM TX CHANNEL 0 HEAD DESC POINTER *

bitfield.description: TX Channel (0..7) DMA Head Descriptor Pointer - Writing a TX DMA Buffer Descriptor address to a head pointer location initiates TX DMA operations in the queue for the selected channel. [[br]]Writing to these locations when they are non-zero is an error (except at reset). [[br]]Host software must initialize these locations to zero on reset. [[br]]

bitfield.description: TX Channel (0..7) DMA Head Descriptor Pointer - Writing a TX DMA Buffer Descriptor address to a head pointer location initiates TX DMA operations in the queue for the selected channel. register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM RX 0 CHANNEL 0 HEAD DESC POINTER *

bitfield.description: RX DMA Head Descriptor Pointer - Writing an RX DMA Buffer Descriptor address to this location allows RX DMA operations in the selected channel when a channel frame is received. [[br]]Writing to these locations when they are non-zero is an error (except at reset). [[br]]Host software must initialize these locations to zero on reset. [[br]]

register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM TX CHANNEL 0 COMPLETION POINTER REGISTER

bitfield.description: Tx Completion Pointer Register - This register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor address for the last buffer processed by the host during interrupt processing. [[br]]The port uses the value written to determine if the interrupt should be deasserted. [[br]]

register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM TX CHANNEL 1 COMPLETION POINTER REGISTER *

bitfield.description: Tx Completion Pointer Register - This register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor address for the last buffer processed by the host during interrupt processing. [[br]]The port uses the value written to determine if the interrupt should be deasserted. [[br]]

register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM TX CHANNEL 2 COMPLETION POINTER REGISTER *

bitfield.description: Tx Completion Pointer Register - This register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor address for the last buffer processed by the host during interrupt processing. [[br]]The port uses the value written to determine if the interrupt should be deasserted. [[br]]

register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM TX CHANNEL 3 COMPLETION POINTER REGISTER *

bitfield.description: Tx Completion Pointer Register - This register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor address for the last buffer processed by the host during interrupt processing. [[br]]The port uses the value written to determine if the interrupt should be deasserted. [[br]]

register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM TX CHANNEL 4 COMPLETION POINTER REGISTER *

bitfield.description: Tx Completion Pointer Register - This register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor address for the last buffer processed by the host during interrupt processing. [[br]]The port uses the value written to determine if the interrupt should be deasserted. [[br]]

register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM TX CHANNEL 5 COMPLETION POINTER REGISTER *

bitfield.description: Tx Completion Pointer Register - This register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor address for the last buffer processed by the host during interrupt processing. [[br]]The port uses the value written to determine if the interrupt should be deasserted. [[br]]

register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM TX CHANNEL 6 COMPLETION POINTER REGISTER *

bitfield.description: Tx Completion Pointer Register - This register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor address for the last buffer processed by the host during interrupt processing. [[br]]The port uses the value written to determine if the interrupt should be deasserted. [[br]]

register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM TX CHANNEL 7 COMPLETION POINTER REGISTER *

bitfield.description: Tx Completion Pointer Register - This register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor address for the last buffer processed by the host during interrupt processing. [[br]]The port uses the value written to determine if the interrupt should be deasserted. [[br]]

register.description: CPDMA_STATERAM RX CHANNEL 0 COMPLETION POINTER REGISTER *

bitfield.description: Rx Completion Pointer Register - This register is written by the host with the buffer descriptor address for the last buffer processed by the host during interrupt processing. [[br]]The port uses the value written to determine if the interrupt should be deasserted. [[br]]Note: The value read is the completion pointer (interrupt acknowledge) value that was written by the CPDMA DMA controller (port). [[br]]The value written to this register by the host is compared with the value that the port wrote to determine if the interrupt should remain asserted. [[br]]The value written is not actually stored in the location. [[br]]The interrupt is deasserted if the two values are equal. [[br]]

[[br]]The value written to this register by the host is compared with the value that the port wrote to determine if the interrupt should remain asserted.
